subproject.description: In line with Sierra Leone’s national priorities, and to contribute to achieving the Integrated Framework Goal of expanding the Country's  participation in the global economy by enhancing their economic growth and poverty reduction strategies, this Project aims at Developing an understanding and road map for future tourism, 2008-2015, that will review, formulate or promulgate relevant regulations and legislations that enhance sustainable tourism development and will identify shared strategic issues that the industry can resolve together;  Influencing the image of Sierra Leone as a tourist destination and Addressing the lack of unique tourist attractions.
subproject.gender code: No noticeable contribution to gender equality
subproject.title: IF Tourism

subproject.corporate outcome: Policies, strategies and partnerships established to enhance public-private sector collaboration and private sector and market development that benefit the poor and ensure that low-income households and small enterprises have access to a broad range of financial and legal services
subproject.description: Improved Capacity for Trade Information in Sierra Leone. The Project aims to empower public and private sector actors to identify and better take advantage of existing local, regional and international economic opportunities by addressing the shortfalls in trade information capacity within Sierra Leone.  The project impacts in 3 key areas. The first involves offering key stakeholders effective and relevant trade information through the new Sierra Leone Investment Export and Promotion Agency (SLIEPA). The second area involves upgrading the Ministry of Trade and Industry’s (MTI) existing database of trade information and developing MTI’s information management capacity. The final area is establishment of a national trade information network.
subproject.gender code: No noticeable contribution to gender equality
subproject.title: IF Trade Policy

subproject.corporate outcome: Policies, strategies and partnerships established to enhance public-private sector collaboration and private sector and market development that benefit the poor and ensure that low-income households and small enterprises have access to a broad range of financial and legal services
subproject.description: Support to government management of the mineral sector for increased transparency efficiency and equity, including (a) development and national roll-out of official minerals cadastre system (b) high-level legal and technical assistance to the Presidential Task Force on minerals contract review and renegotiation (c) support to the Extractive Industries Transparency Initiative (EITI).
subproject.gender code: No noticeable contribution to gender equality
subproject.title: Mineral Sector Support

subproject.corporate outcome: Policies, strategies and partnerships established to enhance public-private sector collaboration and private sector and market development that benefit the poor and ensure that low-income households and small enterprises have access to a broad range of financial and legal services
subproject.description: Expected Outputs:(i) Coordinated policy development and delivery for Private Sector Development interventions through an Advisory and Facilitation Function operating from the Office of the President.(ii) Expanded Private Sector Investment for pro-poor growth through an Investment Generation Function housed in the Office of the President (iii) Established Enhanced Integrated Framework National Implementing Unit housed in the Ministry of Trade and Industry to manage the EIF Global trust fund for Sierra Leone of US$14 mil for trade related technical assistance.
subproject.gender code: No noticeable contribution to gender equality
subproject.title: Private Sector Support

subproject.corporate outcome: Capacities of national and local institutions enhanced to scale up proven MDG acceleration interventions and to plan, monitor, report and evaluate the MDG progress in the context of related national development priorities
subproject.description:
The programme will facilitate multi-donor support to the implementation of Sierra Leone’s Aid Policy using the framework of the agreed Implementation Plan. The Government of Sierra Leone and its development partners will provide funding  for the implementation of a holistic package of activities that will  increase the overall effectiveness of aid in Sierra Leone. These activities are clustered around four main outputs: (1) Supporting a strong Government aid effectiveness team; (2) Increasing coordination at Sector and District levels; (3) Improving aid information and utilisation; (4) Improving mutual accountability for aid effectiveness. 

The Multi-Donor Trust Fund established by the UN for Sierra Leone is proposed as the vehicle to channel both UNDP’s and other development partners’ contributions to this programme. The Ministry of Finance and Economic Development will implement the project through the Development Assistance Coordination Office (DACO) with administrative support from the Integrated Project Administration Unit (IPAU). To minimise transaction costs, funding will be disbursed to the Ministry of Finance and Economic Development (MoFED) in quarterly tranches and all financial requests, reports and accounts centralised in the IPAU.
subproject.gender code: No noticeable contribution to gender equality
subproject.title: Aid Coordination
